member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeConnectionPool
member.summary: This class provides a primitive connection pool for .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeConnectionPool.connections
member.summary: Keeps a list of "keep alive" connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeConnectionPool.CloseSharedConnection(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.Database)
member.summary: Closes the "keep alive" connection that is used by all databases with the same connection string as the one you provide.
member.param: The database with the connection string that defines which connections should be closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeConnectionPool.CloseSharedConnections
member.summary: Closes all "keep alive" connections for all database instanced.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeConnectionPool.CreateConnection(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase)
member.summary: Creates a new connection. If this is the first connection, it also creates an extra "Keep Alive" connection to keep the database open.
member.param: The database instance that will be used to create a connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase
member.summary: Provides helper methods to make working with a Sql Server Compact Edition database easier.

remarks.para: Because Sql Server CE has no connection pooling and the cost of opening the initial connection is high, this class implements a simple connection pool.
Sql Server CE requires full trust to run, so it cannot be used in partial trust environments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a connection string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.CloseSharedConnection
member.summary: This will close the "keep alive" connection that is kept open once you first access the database through this class. Calling this method will close the "keep alive" connection for all instances. The next database access will open a new "keep alive" connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.CreateConnection

summary.para: Creates a connection for this database.

member.remarks: This method has been overridden to support keeping a single connection open until you explicitly close it with a call to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.DeriveParameters(System.Data.Common.DbCommand)
member.summary: Don't need an implementation for Sql Server CE.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.GetStoredProcCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Since Sql Server CE doesn't support stored procedures, we've changed the meaning of queries that take a stored procedure name to take a SQL statement instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.GetStoredProcCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Since Sql Server CE doesn't support stored procedures, we've changed the meaning of queries that take a stored procedure name to take a SQL statement instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.BuildParameterName(System.String)
member.summary: Builds a value parameter name for the current database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.CreateFile
member.summary: Creates a new, empty database file using the file name provided in the Data Source attribute of the connection string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.CreateParameter(System.String,System.Data.DbType,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new parameter and sets the name of the parameter.
member.param: The value you want assigned to this parameter. A null value will be converted to a value in the parameter.
member.returns: A new instance of the correct type for this database.
member.remarks: The database will automatically add the correct prefix, like "@" for SQL Server, to the parameter name. In other words, you can just supply the name without a prefix.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteDataSetSql(System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Executes a SQL SELECT statement and returns a dataset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteNonQuerySql(System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: This method is a short-hand for executing a SQL statement directly since Sql Everywhere doesn't support stored procedures.
member.param: An optional set of parameters and values

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteNonQuerySql(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: This overload allows you to execute an INSERT statement and receive the identity of the row that was inserted for identity tables.
member.param: The identity value for the last row added, or DBNull

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteReaderSql(System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a command and return a that contains the rows returned.
member.param: Zero or more parameters for the query.
member.returns: A that contains the rows returned by the query.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteResultSet(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Data.SqlServerCe.ResultSetOptions,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Sql Server CE provides a new type of data reader, the , that provides new abilities and better performance over a standard reader. This method provides access to this reader.
member.remarks: Unlike other Execute... methods that take a instance, this method does not set the command behavior to close the connection when you close the reader. That means you'll need to close the connection yourself, by calling the command.Connection.Close() method after you're finished using the reader.
member.param: The command that contains the SQL to execute. It should be a SELECT statement.
member.returns: The reader in the form of a

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteResultSet(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Sql Server CE provides a new type of data reader, the , that provides new abilities and better performance over a standard reader. This method provides access to this reader.
member.remarks: Unlike other Execute... methods that take a instance, this method does not set the command behavior to close the connection when you close the reader. That means you'll need to close the connection yourself, by calling the command.Connection.Close() method after you're finished using the reader.
member.param: The command that contains the SQL to execute. It should be a SELECT statement.
member.returns: The reader in the form of a

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.ExecuteScalarSql(System.String,System.Data.Common.DbParameter[])
member.summary: Executes the and returns the first column of the first row in the result set returned by the query. Extra columns or rows are ignored.
member.param: Zero or more parameters for the query.

returns.para: The first column of the first row in the result set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.GetLastId(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Returns the ID of the most recently added row.
member.returns: The ID of the row added, or -1 if no row added, or the table doesn't have an identity column.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Data.SqlCe.SqlCeDatabase.TableExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if a table exists in the open database.
member.returns: true if the table exists, otherwise false.

summary.para: Gets the parameter token used to delimit parameters for the SQL Server database.
